plants.name: Tomato
plants.wateringFrequency: Daily during hot weather, 2-3 times per week in moderate weather
plants.fertilizerRequirements: NPK 10-10-10 initially, then 5-10-5 during flowering; Bone meal, Compost
plants.manureRequirements: Well-aged compost, Cow manure (2-3 kg per plant annually)
plants.specialNotes: Support with stakes/cages, pinch suckers for better fruiting

plants.name: Basil
plants.wateringFrequency: Daily in summer, check soil moisture with finger test
plants.waterAmount: Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged
plants.sunlight: 4-6 hours (morning sun preferred), partial shade in hot climates
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Liquid fertilizer (10-10-10) every 3-4 weeks, low nitrogen preferred
plants.specialNotes: Pinch flowers to encourage leaf growth, protect from cold

plants.name: Rose
plants.wateringFrequency: Daily for potted plants, 2-3 times weekly for ground plants
plants.weatherRequirements: Temperate climate, hardy in most conditions
plants.fertilizerRequirements: High potash feed (like Tomorite) every 2 weeks, Fish Blood & Bone in spring
plants.manureRequirements: Well-rotted manure, compost (½-1 kg per plant annually)
plants.specialNotes: Prune in late winter, feed regularly during growing season

plants.name: Lettuce
plants.wateringFrequency: 2-3 times per week, more in hot weather
plants.waterAmount: Keep soil consistently moist, 1 inch per week
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Balanced fertilizer (10-10-10), nitrogen-rich in early growth
plants.specialNotes: Succession planting every 2-3 weeks, bolt in hot weather

plants.name: Spinach
plants.wateringFrequency: 2-3 times per week
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Nitrogen-rich fertilizer, compost tea
plants.specialNotes: Quick growing, harvest young leaves, bolts in heat

plants.name: Mint
plants.wateringFrequency: Daily in hot weather, every other day otherwise
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Light feeding, balanced liquid fertilizer monthly
plants.specialNotes: Aggressive spreader, best grown in containers

plants.name: Marigold
plants.wateringFrequency: 2-3 times per week
plants.waterAmount: Moderate watering, drought tolerant once established
plants.soilType: Well-draining soil, tolerates poor soils, pH 6.0-7.5
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Low fertility needs, light balanced fertilizer monthly
plants.specialNotes: Pest deterrent, deadhead for continuous blooms

plants.name: Coriander
plants.wateringFrequency: Every other day, reduce when mature
plants.weatherRequirements: Cool season crop, bolts in heat
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Light feeding, balanced fertilizer every 3-4 weeks
plants.specialNotes: Quick growing, succession plant, harvest before flowering

plants.name: Chili Pepper
plants.wateringFrequency: 2-3 times per week, allow soil to dry slightly
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Low nitrogen after flowering, high phosphorus and potassium
plants.specialNotes: Support tall varieties, harvest regularly for production

plants.name: Radish
plants.wateringFrequency: Daily light watering or every other day
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Low nitrogen, phosphorus-rich fertilizer
plants.manureRequirements: Well-composted organic matter, avoid fresh manure
plants.specialNotes: Fast growing (3-4 weeks), direct sow, thin properly

plants.name: Sunflower
plants.wateringFrequency: 2-3 times per week deeply
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Balanced fertilizer, phosphorus for flower development
plants.specialNotes: Support tall varieties, attracts pollinators, edible seeds

plants.name: Green Beans
plants.wateringFrequency: 2-3 times per week at base of plant
plants.soilType: Well-draining, slightly acidic to neutral, pH 6.0-7.0
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Low nitrogen (fixes own), phosphorus and potassium focus
plants.manureRequirements: Light compost, avoid high nitrogen manures
plants.specialNotes: Support pole varieties, nitrogen-fixing, harvest regularly

plants.name: Okra
plants.wateringFrequency: 2-3 times per week
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Balanced fertilizer, side-dress with compost
plants.specialNotes: Heat loving, harvest young pods, continuous harvest

plants.name: Cucumber
plants.wateringFrequency: Daily in hot weather, keep soil evenly moist
plants.fertilizerRequirements: High nitrogen initially, balanced later, side-dress with compost
plants.specialNotes: Provide support/trellises, consistent watering prevents bitterness

plants.name: Nasturtium
plants.wateringFrequency: 2-3 times per week
plants.soilType: Poor to average soil, well-draining, pH 6.1-7.8
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Low fertility needs, avoid high nitrogen
plants.specialNotes: Edible flowers and leaves, natural pest deterrent, climbing variety available

plants.name: Lavender
plants.wateringFrequency: Once a week, drought tolerant once established
plants.waterAmount: Moderate, allow soil to dry between waterings
plants.soilType: Well-draining, sandy or gravelly soil, pH 6.5-7.5
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Low fertility needs, light feeding in spring
plants.specialNotes: Aromatic flowers attract pollinators, used in aromatherapy and cooking

plants.name: Aloe Vera
plants.wateringFrequency: Every 2-3 weeks, less in winter
plants.waterAmount: Deep watering, allow soil to dry completely
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Diluted liquid fertilizer once a month in growing season
plants.specialNotes: Medicinal plant for skin care, air purifying, produces pups for propagation

plants.name: Carrot
plants.wateringFrequency: 2-3 times per week, consistent moisture
plants.waterAmount: 1 inch per week, keep soil evenly moist
plants.soilType: Deep, loose, sandy loam soil, pH 6.0-6.8
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Low nitrogen, high phosphorus and potassium
plants.manureRequirements: Well-composted organic matter, avoid fresh manure
plants.specialNotes: Direct sow, thin seedlings, harvest when roots reach desired size

plants.name: Petunia
plants.wateringFrequency: Daily in hot weather, every other day otherwise
plants.waterAmount: Keep soil moist but not waterlogged
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Balanced liquid fertilizer every 2 weeks
plants.specialNotes: Deadhead regularly for continuous blooms, comes in many vibrant colors

plants.name: Thyme
plants.wateringFrequency: Once a week, drought tolerant
plants.waterAmount: Light watering, allow soil to dry between waterings
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Light feeding, once in spring
plants.specialNotes: Culinary herb, attracts pollinators, low maintenance ground cover

plants.name: Zinnia
plants.wateringFrequency: 2-3 times per week
plants.waterAmount: 1 inch per week, water at base
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Balanced fertilizer monthly
plants.specialNotes: Excellent cut flowers, attracts butterflies, deadhead for more blooms

plants.name: Eggplant
plants.wateringFrequency: Daily in hot weather, 2-3 times per week otherwise
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Balanced fertilizer, side-dress with compost
plants.specialNotes: Support heavy fruits, harvest when glossy and firm

plants.name: Parsley
plants.wateringFrequency: 2-3 times per week
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly
plants.specialNotes: Rich in vitamins, slow to germinate, harvest outer leaves first

plants.name: Pumpkin
plants.wateringFrequency: 2-3 times per week deeply
plants.fertilizerRequirements: High nitrogen early, then phosphorus and potassium
plants.specialNotes: Requires lots of space, hand pollination may help, harvest when skin is hard

plants.name: Geranium
plants.wateringFrequency: 2-3 times per week
plants.waterAmount: Moderate, allow soil to dry slightly between waterings
plants.fertilizerRequirements: Balanced liquid fertilizer every 2-3 weeks
plants.specialNotes: Deadhead spent blooms, can be overwintered indoors, pest resistant
